snippet.title: 'Walking Dead': Family friendly version on the way
snippet.description:
* Ever wonder what AMC's ultra-violent hit "The Walking Dead" would be like if it was edited for a broadcast network instead?
http://www.cnn.com/2014/03/20/showbiz/tv/walking-dead-family-friendly/index.html

snippet.title: 'Grimm' star on show's surprise success
snippet.description:
* "Who saw that coming?" That was Silas Weir Mitchell's reaction to the fact that "Grimm" was picked up for a second season on NBC. The fairy tale/horror/procedural hybrid was recently renewed, despite its tough Friday night timeslot (versus established...
http://marquee.blogs.cnn.com/2012/03/30/grimm-star-on-shows-surprise-success/

snippet.title: David Giuntoli and the underdog success of 'Grimm'
snippet.description:
* Of the fall television season, it's probably safe to say, NBC's "Grimm" was not expected to be the breakout hit, or any hit for that matter.
http://www.cnn.com/2011/12/08/showbiz/tv/giuntoli-grimm-success/index.html

snippet.title: 'Grimm' a genre hybrid that doesn't quite work
snippet.description:
* On Friday's series premiere of "Grimm," we were introduced to our second take on fairy tales in less than a week's time, this one a little more of a police procedural. Nick Burkhardt is a detective who suddenly finds himself having inherited the power...
http://marquee.blogs.cnn.com/2011/10/29/grimm-a-genre-hybrid-that-doesnt-quite-work/

snippet.title: ‘Once Upon a Time’ is almost magical
snippet.description:
* Imagine if the characters from all of your favorite fairy tales lived in the real world. That’s the basic setup for “Once Upon a Time,” one of this season’s two new shows that use classic fables for their inspiration. (The other, “Grimm,” premieres...
http://marquee.blogs.cnn.com/2011/10/24/%e2%80%98once-upon-a-time%e2%80%99-almost-magical/

snippet.title: 'The Bible' producers: Claim of Obama-Satan resemblance is 'utter nonsense'
snippet.description:
* By Dan Merica, CNN Washington (CNN) - The third episode of the History Channel's miniseries “The Bible” was supposed to be remembered for the brutality of Babylonian ruler Nebuchadnezzar, the strength of Daniel in the lion’s den, and the birth of Jesus...
http://religion.blogs.cnn.com/2013/03/18/twitter-explodes-over-history-channel-resemblance-of-obama-and-satan/

snippet.title: Episodic games deliver fun in spurts
snippet.description:
* Even as gaming begins to challenge television as a leading mass entertainment medium, the industry continues to struggle with the serialized model that's made broadcast programming a nightly must-see for many.

snippet.title: 'American Idol' recap: 13 men and a confused baby's nipple
snippet.description:
* Welcome to the live shows! We've got an all-new American Idol set featuring a giant spacecraft-y oval that reminds me a little too much of The X Factor, and some wind-machined amber waves of grain behind Ryan to remind us of how easy breezy beautiful representative of America he is. (Noted.)
http://www.cnn.com/2012/02/29/showbiz/tv/american-idol-recap-ew/index.html
